title: 105_s547
content: The Act may be cited as the "Government Shutdown Prevention Act" and includes provisions for continuing funding. If a regular appropriation bill for fiscal year 1998 is not passed, funds from the Treasury will be used to continue programs from fiscal year 1997 at 98% of the previous funding level. Appropriations and funds for fiscal year 1998 will be available during a lapse in appropriations until the regular appropriation bill becomes law or until the end of fiscal year 1998. SEC. 3. TERMS AND CONDITIONS. Appropriations made for fiscal year 1998 will follow the terms and conditions of the previous fiscal year. Appropriations under this Act will be available as provided in the pertinent appropriations Act. SEC. 4. COVERAGE. SEC. 4. COVERAGE. Appropriations and funds for fiscal year 1998 under this Act cover all obligations and expenditures for programs, projects, or activities during the applicable period. Expenditures will be charged to the appropriate appropriation when a regular appropriation bill becomes law. SEC. 6. No funds from this Act can be used to start or continue programs without available appropriations in fiscal year 1997. SEC. 7. This Act does not affect government obligations under other laws like Social Security and veterans benefits. SEC. 8. Definition. The term "regular appropriation bill" refers to annual bills that allocate funds for various categories such as agriculture, defense, education, and energy and water development. The regular appropriation bill allocates funds for various categories including energy, water development, foreign assistance, military construction, transportation, Treasury Department, U.S. Postal Service, and legislative branch.
